content.description: Central Perk, the gang, except Rachel, is watching a new singer.

content.speaker: Singer
content.text: ‘Cause every time I see your face, I can’t help but fall from grace. I know…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow! This girl is good.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh-ho yeah! A song with rhyming words. Oo, I never thought of that before.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I like her.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why? Because she can sing and play guitar and do both at the same time?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, that’s pretty much all I’m looking for from these people.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look at you. All jealous.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah Pheebs, come on, you two have completely different styles. Y’know, she’s more..(shakes his shoulders, like he’s dancing) y’know, and you’re more (sees the look from Phoebe and stops)

content.speaker: Singer
content.text: beside meeeee-eeee-ee. (everyone applauds her).

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, see, see, everyone else is happy she’s done.

content.speaker: Singer
content.text: Okay, my next song’s called: Phoebe Buffay, What Can I Say. I Really Loved When We Were Singing Partners, And I Shouldn’t Have Left You That Way.
(The gang all looks at Phoebe.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no, one of those ‘look for the hidden meaning’ songs.

content.speaker: Singer
content.text: Hey Phoebe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey Leslie, how’d you know I’d be here?

content.speaker: Leslie
content.text: I ran into Vlad at the place where they sell the big fish, and he said you played here a lot, so umm…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right listen, I have to go to the bathroom, but if the place with the big fish comes up again. I’d like know whether that’s several big fish or just one big fish.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So ah, Phoebe tells us you write jingles.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Actually I said she abandoned me to write jingles.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah, anything we might of heard of?

content.speaker: Leslie
content.text: Ah, yeah, umm. (singing) Home is never far away..

content.speaker: Monica, Ross, and Joey
content.text: Home is Home Star stew.

content.speaker: Leslie
content.text: Yeah, but, I don’t do that anymore. I got kinda sick of it, and then I couldn’t come up with anything good, so they fired me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hmm, bummer.

content.speaker: Leslie
content.text: Well, I y’know, I was just, umm, I was just thinking and hoping, that umm, maybe you’d want to get back together?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No. But thanks.

content.speaker: Leslie
content.text: Aw come on Phoebe would you just think about it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. No. But thanks.

content.speaker: Leslie
content.text: Okay, ah, see ya Pheebs. (leaves)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow, that was kinda brutal.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well okay, let this be a lesson to all of you, all right. Once you, once you betray me, I become like the ice woman, y’know. Very cold, hard, unyielding, y’know nothing, nothing can penetrate this icy exterior. (to Monica) Can I have a tissue, please?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, sure.

content.description: Outside the bathroom, Chandler is pacing back and fourth, waiting is use it.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Someone in there?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No. This is just part of a dare devil game that I play called ‘wait until the last moment before I burst and die.’
(The door opens.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Jeez, man did you fall..(sees it’s a beautiful woman coming out of the men’s room) Hi! So ah, did ya, did-did-did ya fall high?

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Someone was in the lady’s room, I couldn’t wait. I left the lid up for ya though.
(Gunther walks up)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what Gunther, go ah, go ahead, I’m-I’m talking to ah, (tries to get her to say her name). (to her) This is the part where you say your name.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Ginger.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ginger. I’m talking to Ginger, so…

content.speaker: Ginger
content.text: Don’t you have to use the bathroom?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nope, nope, I’d just ah, I’d rather talk to you. (pause) Yes, I do. Yes, I do have to go to the bathroom. (knocks on the door)

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Someone in here.

content.description: Central Perk, the gang’s putting their coats on to leave.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Where’s Chandler?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah, he can’t make it, he said he had to his… (sees Ginger) Whoa-oh! (hides behind the coat rack.)

content.speaker: Ginger
content.text: Joey? Joey Tribbiani?
(She walks over behind the coat rack, but Joey picks it up and moves it so that he’s still behind it, and she can’t see him.)

content.speaker: Ginger
content.text: Joey I can see you okay? You’re hiding behind the coats.
(Joey puts his finger over his mouth to tell Ross to keep quiet. Ginger looks at Monica who looks away and leave.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Phew, close one.

content.description: Rachel’s office, Mark is packing his stuff into a box.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi, sweetie!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Hi, Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, huh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’ve got some bad news.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I can get a quick bite to eat, but then I have to come back up here.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on sweetie! You’ve had to work late every night for the past two weeks, what is it this time?

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Actually, it’s kinda my fault. I-I quit today.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: But work comes first! (to Mark) Oh hey, but that’s sad about you though, what happened? Burn out? Burn all out, did ya?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Nooo, he’s leaving for a better job.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh well that’s great, so I guess this is ah, this is good bye then. Huh? (picks a pad up off Rachel’s desk and tosses it into his box) Good bye.

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Okay, then.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well we’re gonna miss you around here.

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Yeah, me too.
(Rachel goes to hug him but Ross is holding one of her hands and doesn’t let go, so she can only put one arm around him.)

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: So, see ya on Saturday.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, you bet.
(Ross is shocked, but Rachel drags him out of the office.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe and Monica are playing with a Ouija board, Phoebe’s beeper goes off and Monica screams.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh. (takes her beeper puts in a pot, covers it, and puts the pot in the oven)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know those are a delicacy in India.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, that was Leslie calling again to see if we can get back together. That’s the twentieth time today! And good luck Leslie!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow, she must have hurt you pretty bad, huh?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, yeah. Y’know, we were best friends, ever since we were little, our Moms worked on the barge together.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, you two must have been so cute running around on a barge.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You never run on a barge!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe and Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Is ah, is Chandler around?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, umm, he met some girl at the coffee house.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oooh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, Ginger something.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nooo. No, no, ah, are you sure it wasn’t something that sounded like Ginger, like ah, Gingeer?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, it was Ginger. I remember, because when he told me, I said, (singing) ‘the movie star.’

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Aww, man. That’s the girl I was hiding from. When she finds out he’s my roommate, she’s gonna tell him what I did.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, what did you do?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What, oh, oh, oh, no, no, I can’t, I can’t tell you that, it’s like the most awful, horrible thing I’ve ever done my whole life.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know what, don’t tell us. We’ll just wait until Chandler gets home, (to Phoebe) because it’ll be more fun that way.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right!! Okay, it was like four years ago. Okay, Ginger and I had gone out a few times, and then this one weekend, we went up to her Dad’s cabin. Just me, her, and her annoying little dog Pepper. Well that night, I cooked this really romantic dinner…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You gave her food poisoning!?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I wish. No. After dinner, me, her, and Pepper all fell asleep in front of the fire. Well I woke up in the middle of the night and I saw that the fire was dying out. So, I picked up a log and threw it on. Or, at least what I thought was a log.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God!! You threw Pepper on the fire!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I wish. See, I guess another thing I probably should’ve told you about Ginger is that she kinda has a ah, artificial leg.
(Phoebe and Monica both stand up and gasp.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! Joey, what did you do after you threw her leg on the fire?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I ran!!

content.description: A street, Chandler is kissing Ginger.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, that’s the best kiss I’ve had with anyone I’ve ever met in a men’s room.

content.speaker: Ginger
content.text: Actually, me too.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Op, foot in a puddle, foot all in a puddle.
content.parenthetical: sees her foot is in a slush puddle

content.speaker: Ginger
content.text: Oh damn, I hate that.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, we’re gonna have to get you out of those shoes.

content.speaker: Ginger
content.text: Oh, don’t worry about it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, really you’re gonna freeze.

content.speaker: Ginger
content.text: No, I’m not.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re not, what do you, what do you got a bionic foot?

content.speaker: Ginger
content.text: Some day, maybe.

content.description: Ross’s bedroom, Rachel getting into bed while Ross is reading and laughs.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Funny book?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hmmm. Oh, no, no, I just thinking about something funny I heard today. Umm, Mark, Mark saying ‘I’ll see you Saturday.’

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, at the lecture, I told you that last week, you said you didn’t mind.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, no, no, no, it’s-it’s not the lecture ah, I mind, umm…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, please tell me it’s not because I’m going with Mark.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, well…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God!!! Ross!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I’m sorry, but ah, look if you’re not working with him anymore, why do you have to still do stuff with him?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Because, he’s my friend.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, but do you really need another friend? I mean…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, well if I stop playing with Joey and Chandler, can I play with Mark?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Is that funny? Am I supposed to be laughing?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know, you thought ‘See you Saturday’ was funny. Look honey, Mark is in fashion okay, I like having a friend that I can share this stuff with. You guys would never want to go to a lecture with me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Pa-haa!! I would love to go with you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really!?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, hey I-I have clothes, I even pick them out. I mean for, for all you know I could be a fashion… monger.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Honey, I would love for you to go with me. (Ross has a worried look on his face) What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What should I wear, now I’m all nervous.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe is looking at her beeper still in the pot. She takes it out, shakes it, and puts it back in.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know they say a watched pot never beeps.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s just y’know, been a couple of hours, and she hasn’t called. Not that I even care, y’know.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe why don’t you just call her? You obviously want to.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You think you know me so well.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, don’t ‘cha wanna?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, well I do know you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s what I said.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well so?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can’t. I can’t. She dumped me, I mean I totally trusted her and then one day it was ‘Okay, bye Pheebs’ gone. Y’know what the saddest part is, when we were playing together, that was like the most fun I’ve ever had in like all my lives.

content.speaker: Leslie
content.text: My best shoes, so good to me. I wear them everyday. Down at the heel, holes in the toes. Don’t care what people say. My feet’s best friends, pals to the end. With them I’m one hot chicky. Though late one night, not much light, I…
(Phoebe runs in and joins her.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I stepped in something icky.

content.speaker: Phoebe and Leslie
content.text: Sticky shoes, sticky shoes, always make me smile. Sticky shoes, sticky shoes, next time I’ll… avoid the… pillleeeee.

content.description: The lecture, Rachel is listening closely, Ross is bored out of his mind.

content.speaker: Lecturer
content.text: We’re beginning to see a lot of layering of sheer fabrics and colours. For instance a sheer navy blouse over a pink…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m really glad we came. (Rachel smiles and rubs his arm) You’re so pretty. I love you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh. (puts her hand over his mouth)

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is teaching Leslie how to sing Smelly Cat.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Smelly cat, smelly cat, what are they feeding you? Smelly cat, smelly cat, it’s not your fault.

content.speaker: Leslie
content.text: Wow, that’s great.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, yeah!

content.speaker: Leslie
content.text: Y’know you could totally sell this. It’d be perfect for like umm, a kitty litter campaign.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I…, a jingle? No, no-no-no, no.

content.speaker: Leslie
content.text: What? Why not? You could make a ton of money.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, well if I was in this for the money, I’d be a millionaire by now, y’know. You just got to get out of that jingle head sweetie.

content.speaker: Leslie
content.text: Aw, you’re right, you’re right. I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s okay. All right, I’m gonna play song that’s really, really sad. It’s called Magician Box Mix Up. (she turns her guitar upside down to play it.)

content.description: The lecture, Ross is passed out against Rachel’s shoulder.

content.speaker: Lecturer
content.text: …oversized bracelets, oversized earrings, oversizing of accessories in general are very popular now.
(Ross wakes up with a start and startles Rachel. The guy next to him starts laughing, which starts Ross laughing, Rachel gives him a look and he stops.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is reading the newspaper.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, can I borrow this? (points to his milk) My milk’s gone bad.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I hate that. I once had a thing of half and half, stole my car.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So umm, how was your date with Ginger?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Great. It was great. She’s ah, she’s great, great looking, great personality, she’s greatness.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sounds like she’s got the ah, whole package.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey told you about the leg, huh?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh God, it freaked me out. Okay, I know it shouldn’t have, but it did. I mean I like her, I don’t want to stop seeing her, but every so often it’s like ‘Hey, y’know what, where’s your leg?’ I mean I’m the smallest person in the world aren’t I? I’m the smallest person in the world.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Morning.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Actually he’s the smallest person in the world.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Heard about the leg burnin’ huh?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It came up.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Listen, I ah, I know it’s a longshot. But, by any chance did she find that funny?
(Both Chandler and Monica walk away in disgust.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross and Rachel are getting back from the lecture.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So I nodded off a little.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Nodded off!! Ross you were snoring. My father’s boat didn’t make that much noise when it hit rocks!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on! Forty-five minutes! Forty-five minutes the man talked about strappy backed dresses.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well okay, how about four hours in a freezing museum auditorium listening to Professor Pitstains and he’s ‘Hey everybody! Remember that thing that’s been dead for a gazillion years. Well there’s this little bone we didn’t know it had!’

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: First of all it’s Professor Pittain! And second of all, that little bone, proved that, that particular dinosaur had wings, but didn’t fly.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, see now, what I just heard: blah-blah-blah, blah-blah-blah-blah-blah, blah-blah-blah, blah, blah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know what, 100 million people went to see a movie about what I do, I wonder how many people would go see a movie called, Jurassic Parka.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, that is so…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No-no-no, a bunch of out of control jackets take over an island. (Makes an unusual sound, then he realises that he still has his jacket on and quickly tries to shake it off, thinking it’s alive and attacking him.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know if what I do is so lame, then why did you insist on coming with me this morning? Huh? Was it so I just wouldn’t go with Mark?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. I… I wanted to be with you. I don’t know, I feel like lately, I feel like you’re slipping away from me, y’know. With this new job, and all these new people, and you’ve got this whole other life going on. I-I-I know it’s dumb, but I hate that I’m not a part of it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s not dumb. But, maybe it’s okay that you’re not a part of it. Y’know what I mean? (Ross looks confused) I mean it’s like, I-I-I like that you’re not involved in that part of my life.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s a little clearer.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey see, it doesn’t mean that I don’t love you. Because I do. I love you, I love you so much. But my work it’s-it’s for me y’know, I’m out there, on my own, and I’m doing it and it’s scary but I love it, because it’s mine. I, but, I mean is that okay?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sure, I-I-I… (hugs her and mouths No!!)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler and Ginger are eating dinner.

content.speaker: Ginger
content.text: Your thinking about my leg aren’t you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No. No. Actually I forgot, what is the deal with that again?

content.speaker: Ginger
content.text: It’s okay if it bothers you. Really. I mean the only thing I need to know is: ‘How much it bothers you?’ because I don’t like wasting my time. Am I wasting my time?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No. No. I don’t think so.

content.speaker: Ginger
content.text: Okay. It’s just like anything else, you just have to get used to it.
(They start making out. She opens his shirt and feels inside and stops.)

content.speaker: Ginger
content.text: What’s that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s-that’s my nubbin.

content.speaker: Ginger
content.text: What’s a nubbin?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s kinda a ah, a third nipple kinda thing.

content.speaker: Ginger
content.text: You have three nipples?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, y’know two regulars. And ah one that barely qualifies as… (starts to kiss her again, but she gets up.) Ahh, what?

content.speaker: Ginger
content.text: Nothing. I, I just remembered I have to leave.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You ah, you have, you have to leave, now? How come?

content.speaker: Ginger
content.text: Ah well, it’s nubbin. Nothing! Umm. Y’know what, I’ll see you later. Okay. (She leaves and in the hall we see her shake her shoulders like when someone runs their fingernails across a blackboard.)

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is getting ready to sing as Leslie enters.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I thought you weren’t coming. What? Where were you?

content.speaker: Leslie
content.text: Come here, come here. (they go to the side of the stage) Okay, don’t get mad, okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, don’t give me a reason to get mad, okay

content.speaker: Leslie
content.text: I played Smelly Cat for the people at my old ad agency, they went nuts.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, look, I told you that I didn’t want you to try and sell it, and you just, you big fat did it anyway. God, y’know what, I think five years ago I probably would’ve done anything to play with you but, I can do it by myself. And if I can’t trust you then just forget it.

content.speaker: Leslie
content.text: No, no, I don’t want to forget it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay y’know what you have to choose. All right, if-if the most important thing on the planet to you is this cat poopy thing then, okay you can have Smelly Cat, but we won’t be partners. So what’s it gonna be?

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe, Monica, and Joey are watching TV.

content.speaker: Commercial
content.text: Problem odour in the litter box? Don’t change your kitty, change your kitty litter.
content.parenthetical: in the background their singing Smelly Cat

content.text: (Monica gets up and shuts off the TV.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sorry, Pheebs.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. You okay?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. I actually am, yeah. Y’know life-life’s gonna had you all kinds of stuff, y’know you learn your little lessons and hopefully you grow. Wanna hear a new song?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’d love too.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. (singing) ‘Jingle bitch screwed me over! Go to hell jingle whore! Go to hell Go to hell. Go to hell-hell-hell.’ That’s all I have so far.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the whole gang except Chandler is there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well hello!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Where have you been?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The doctor.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Is everything okay?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yes! Just had me a little nubbin-ectomy. Yep! Two nipples, no waiting.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow! It’s like Rachel in High School.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on! Come on, I was kidding! It was such an obvious joke!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That was an obvious joke, and I didn’t think of it. Why didn’t I think of it? The source of all my powers. Oh dear God, what have I done!
